body: @marcelatoffernet Would you mind to provide more information about why we need to support Nerdctl ? (e.g. it support some advanced feature ? )

Got it.
Is Nerdctl totally open-sourced and can be used without any limitations ?

It's apache licence 2.0 (https://github.com/containerd/nerdctl/blob/master/LICENSE), falls under the containrd project, which in turn is part of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation. 

I'm not a lawyer obviously so don't take my opinion as fact here.
@marcelatoffernet Make sense! Are you interested in contributing ? We are happy to review your work, thank you!
@WeichenXu123 I am willing to contribute. I will just need a few pointers / possible way to do it or where to start looking.

You can start looking from https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/970ac4362bb53ce64a2bdd8743d2e8ed4dd42f83/mlflow/pyfunc/backend.py#L282

thanks! :)

rename.to: [FR] Support other Container Engines / Build Tools

body:
@WeichenXu123  Please see this commit: https://github.com/marcelatoffernet/mlflow/commit/a75d4c9f67315ed01bd0de928990e5b306c767df

```zsh
mlflow models build-docker \
-m file:///Users/marcelcoetzee/Work/gits/mlflow/examples/mlruns/0/f8582184d2904652b55e3659db01bdce/artifacts/model/ \
-n fb-model \
--enable-mlserver \
--container-engine="podman"
```

Observe that Podman manages to stand in as direct replacement for Docker:

```console
2022/04/28 12:15:15 INFO mlflow.models.cli: Selected backend for flavor 'python_function'
2022/04/28 12:15:15 INFO mlflow.models.docker_utils: Building docker image with name fb-model
/var/folders/xg/rgpbm50j7xs68b9ghqt9mxdr0000gn/T/tmppqt1s404/
/var/folders/xg/rgpbm50j7xs68b9ghqt9mxdr0000gn/T/tmppqt1s404//model_dir
/var/folders/xg/rgpbm50j7xs68b9ghqt9mxdr0000gn/T/tmppqt1s404//model_dir/model.pr
/var/folders/xg/rgpbm50j7xs68b9ghqt9mxdr0000gn/T/tmppqt1s404//model_dir/requirements.txt
/var/folders/xg/rgpbm50j7xs68b9ghqt9mxdr0000gn/T/tmppqt1s404//model_dir/MLmodel
/var/folders/xg/rgpbm50j7xs68b9ghqt9mxdr0000gn/T/tmppqt1s404//model_dir/conda.yaml
/var/folders/xg/rgpbm50j7xs68b9ghqt9mxdr0000gn/T/tmppqt1s404//Dockerfile
2022/04/28 12:15:15 INFO mlflow.models.docker_utils: Using container engine podman to build image ...
STEP 1/20: FROM ubuntu:18.04
STEP 2/20: RUN apt-get -y update
--> Using cache a92a510fbd11256a8199617aae5b37f8985fa6d3d72116925cf2a159ed96dd48
--> a92a510fbd1
STEP 3/20: RUN apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends          wget          curl          nginx          ca-certificates          bzip2          build-essential          cmake          openjdk-8-jdk          git-core          maven     && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
--> Using cache 7e8bfbb67811403b623e5a46fa9d3bcb20023bdeb9eb46d6dcdc701b5a661e2e
--> 7e8bfbb6781
STEP 4/20: RUN curl -L https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh >> miniconda.sh
--> Using cache d100cc197a26a370fabc0a07bb31ddcd44be557b600552e65f5576ec7dd2f055
--> d100cc197a2
STEP 5/20: RUN bash ./miniconda.sh -b -p /miniconda && rm ./miniconda.sh
PREFIX=/miniconda
Unpacking payload ...
./miniconda.sh: line 416: /miniconda/conda.exe: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
./miniconda.sh: line 418: /miniconda/conda.exe: cannot execute binary file: Exec format error
```

The reason Miniconda executable failed to run was because I'm on arm. I suggest that we look into substituting the Minconda that gets pulled. Perhaps with

```Dockerfile
RUN curl -L https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-$(uname -m).sh >> miniconda.sh
```

Many K8s clusters not even running x86 so giving option to compile to desired arch maybe good?
